qas.question: Where was the fatal June 19th riots?
What did the rioters try to take over?

answers.text: police station and a water-supply station

qas.question: How many towns had riots of their own following the initial riots?

context: In Kazakhstan on June 19, 1989, <a1_0>young men<a1_0/> carrying guns, firebombs, iron bars and stones rioted in <a0_0>Zhanaozen<a0_0/>, causing a number of deaths. The youths tried to seize a <a2_0>police station and a water-supply station<a2_0/>. They brought public transportation to a halt and shut down various shops and industries. By June 25, the rioting had spread to <a3_0>five<a3_0/> other towns near the Caspian Sea. A mob of about 150 people armed with sticks, stones and metal rods attacked the <a4_0>police station<a4_0/> in Mangishlak, about 90 miles from Zhanaozen, before they were dispersed by government troops flown in by helicopters. Mobs of young people also rampaged through Yeraliev, Shepke, Fort-Shevchenko and Kulsary, where they poured flammable liquid on trains housing temporary workers and set them on fire.
